Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: brian-o-mac
Reviews.Content: 7 nights in Madrid staying in the Espahotel on Grand Via. Room: Large, clean, comfortable and comes with a small kitchen - Air Con big plus too! Location: Excellent, eastern side of Grand Via and close to everything! Staff: Very Good and Spoke English Issues: None! Tips: Take Metro from Airport the stop is outside the hotel (line 10 Plaza de Espana) Recommend: Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: adrianal
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel for my Christmas holiday 2010. The hotel is located in the heart of Madrid near the main shops and theaters. The hotel is clean and the service is good. The rooms have a good size plus a small kitchenette so you can save money if you want to keep some snacks in the room. This is a modern or fancy hotel however it is clean, spacious and most of all has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Location, Good Price.”
Reviews.Author: thesharma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with couple of friends in May, 2012. THe place is true to its online description and is intact better in a few. Positves: -Excellent location, walking distance from Kings palace Madrid, Dabod Temple, and the 5 minutes from the nearest Metro Station and loads of eateries and Grocery Stores. - fast checkin, clean rooms, fridge and panty available in the room. Not So Positives: - No free wifi - Not so homely rooms, not much decor. - Not so polite staff, but not sure either. - we got a loft facing room, but then sum1 has to get it. - a "tired" property. overall good for its location, reasonably priced by madrid standards.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the great location, adequate comfort and low price”
Reviews.Author: jengel56
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised. When you pay only 60 Euros, I do not have high expectations. If you want a Marriot, pay the $200 Euros and enjoy the comfort. Our room was plenty large, had a desk and sofa, tiny but functional kitchen, excellent bathroom with great hot shower. Close to Metro, and short walk to Plaza Callao and Puerta del Sol. Restaurants, bars and shopping in abundance all around. Two tapas bars, and Starbucks right next door. Cinema and Dunkin Donuts, LOTS of restaurants within five minute walk. We had a room on the 7th floor toward the back and it was perfectly quiet. Breakfast is not included, but who cares? Go to the tapas bar next store and have a great little breakfast for 5 Euro.The internet costs 6 Euros per day, but it is fast. For the price, this is a five star.

Reviews.Title: “I got eaten alive by bed bugs !”
Reviews.Author: fran15111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights recently. The positives great location in the centre of Madrid. On the negative side. My legs are full of red marks from being awaken scratching the skin off my legs. The bedding is extremely old and needs cleaning/updating. I went to the supermarket and sprayed all the bedding but it didn´t seem to helñp much. Also the security for me was not good. The keys as mentioned in other reviews are old fashioned and need to be left at the reception and you tell them the room number when you come back to the hotel. The problem is that they give you any key without checking your name or questioning you. This for me is a big defect as the give you whatever key you ask for without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and adequate comfort”
Reviews.Author: FelipeRocha
Reviews.Content: The location is the most positive aspect in this hotel: quite near the Royal Palace and the Gran Via, with a metro station in the square just ahead. But the hotel is good, despite not for those looking for luxury or immaculate services. The positives: The comfort is adequate; the bed and pillows are very good; the room is bigger than the average; the air condition is good and necessary, because you have to keep the double window closed due to the noise of the street (with it closed you hear nothing from streets); there is a small kitchen in the room which helps a lot to buy things in supermarkets; the bathroom is good, the desk staff is very gentle, despite a little unprepared. The negatives: There is no breakfast included and the hotel snack bar is not good, I recommend having the breakfast in other places or, better, to buy things in supermarkets and eat in the room (I recommend the “El Corte Ingles”); the service is just adequate; the hotel seems a little old.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable self sufficient stay at this aprtment hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Himjal
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the hotel is very friendly & warm. Always helping. The rooms are self sufficient with all the reqd. amenitites. Had wonderful time. The service too is good. The staff can speak english as well. It is centraly located in Madrid with the Metro station close by & all the bus stands too, nearby. It is good value for money & would recomend too everyone... definitely would stay here again, if i happen to visit Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: anmelbourne
Reviews.Content: Had 2 adjoining rooms (2 brs 2 bathrooms 2 kitchenettes + living area) in mid June. Rooms were very clean and front desk very helpful. Personally did not love the location at the lower end of the gran via, but there are ameities nearby in walking distance. Temperature in Madrid was in mid thirties on several days and unfortunately the air-conditioning in this hotel is prehistoric and so we sweltered. on the last night we finally requested a fan. It's also worth noting, if smells bother, that while the rooms say "no smoking" it certainly smells like that's been ignored on many occasions. Overall ok on a budget, but definitely not 4*

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnaMaria-Lisbon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of Madrid, close the Gran Via and near the Royal Palace. We stayed in a triple room wich had a small kitchennet. The room was very clean and nice. The staff was helpful. From Barajas airport, we have to take the metro to the Nuevos Ministerios station (line 8). At this station we have to change to metro line 10 toward Puerta del Sur and exit in Plaza de España station. The hotel is about 50-100m from this metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel to check-in, I found two of my fellow guests paying their bill in cash – and counting out coins to come up with an adequate sum. Now I have nothing against extreme budget travelers – I myself traveled this way on my first trip to Europe over 25 years ago. I have many happy memories of those salad days. If you find yourself in that category, I heartily recommend the Plaza de Espana, because it is a palace compared to some of the places I stayed back in the day. However, if, like me, somewhere over the years you "graduated" to the Marriott, Hilton or any of their international or boutique equivalents, you might want to consider staying at, um, one of those places. Good points: The staff was very friendly and helpful, making themselves understood despite the language barrier. The public areas and the room were clean. Room service is available and the rooms have kitchenettes, so you can prepare modest meals yourself. The rooms have a lovely view of the Plaza de Espana, and if you don't mind traffic noise, you can get some fresh air as the windows do open. The bathroom had a built in hairdryer and there was a safe in the closet. The television offerings included numerous Spanish networks, CNN, RTL (German network) and a station I think was in French. There is a computer with internet access in the lobby that is coin-operated: the price is competitive and you only pay for what you need. Downsides: The furnishings were quite modest – the bed was hard, the linens were cheap and somewhat worn (although clean). There was no clock, radio or combo thereof. I could not turn on the old, small television until an employee demonstrated the "trick" for getting it to work. The air conditioner wasn't working really well in my room (but see note above about the windows). In general, there was a rundown feeling about the place. Security note: The hotel still uses actual keys for the room with a huge keyfob that has the hotel name and room number on it – unlike the more discreet unmarked key cards that are common today. Also, the hotel is only half a block from the Metro station, but a building between the station and the hotel is being renovated (as of July 2008). Pedestrians have to walk under a scaffolding that is dark and isolated – fine during the day, but security-minded patrons may want to take care after dark. Note: The hotel is now part of the Espahotel chain, which has five or six hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “dull hotel- you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: yodalia
Reviews.Content: Location: okay, but not great. Not so close to many sites but close to public transportation and city sightseeing buses. Room: the first room we were showed to reeked of smoke. We had asked for non-smoking so we switched. This room had a funny smell but after leaving the window open for a while the smell wore off. The room was nice sized, and had a little kitchenette. A/c worked well--important, as it was really, really hot in Madrid. The beds weren't so comfortable and the furniture was a bit run-down. But wasn't so surprised because the hotel was pretty cheap. Our only real problem was the reception. They were very nice and accommodating but they didn't know English. When we arrived, there was one person there who didn't know English, but the next morning there was one woman who did. Later when we returned, no one who knew English. A little annoying when we needed directions and other help, but they tried. Also, we saw a cockroach in the lobby. Was quite funny actually because the receptionist said, "Cucaracha!!" We all thought that was pretty humorous. Overall, would I stay there again? Probably not but I wouldn't rule it out completely.
